body:
Makes neovim buildable on Cygwin without the need of manually installing the dependencies defined by cmake.deps. Normal method using make && make install shall work now also for Cygwin.

comment_data.body: I think this is missing the `CopyFilesGlob.cmake` commands the other windows builds have for the extra `share` files luajit ships with. I don't think you'll notice them missing unless you specifically try to call on a function from them like in `p.lua`.

Kinda hacky, I think the "correct" way to do this would be to search for `cyglua51.dll` in `cmake/FindLuajit.cmake` and drop something like `list(APPEND LUAJIT_NAMES cyglua51)` (that or maybe it's `libcyglua511`).

comment_regular_data.body: I see in https://github.com/LuaJIT/LuaJIT/commit/55a42da36ea6dd357ef928dd5c6776278b32ab92 that luajit has dropped support for cygwin, which makes me hesitant to include this. We could merge this on a "if it works, it works" basis but I suspect it will stop working in the near future anyway. I'd lean towards not merging this, but don't feel strongly enough to block if @justinmk or @jamessan like this.
Wait, hold up. I just reread the commit message. What do you mean make it buildable without depending on `cmake.deps`? You're modidying a file in `cmake.deps` though?

> I see in [LuaJIT/LuaJIT@55a42da](https://github.com/LuaJIT/LuaJIT/commit/55a42da36ea6dd357ef928dd5c6776278b32ab92) that luajit has dropped support for cygwin,

Thanks for mentioning that.
Does building Nvim with PUC Lua on cygwin work, currently? We should focus on that. And show an error or at least a warning if trying to build with cygwin + luajit. And update our docs with guidance.

> Does building Nvim with PUC Lua on cygwin work, currently?

@ptomulik can you confirm? Build instructions on how to use Lua instead of Luajit should be in `build.md`.

> Wait, hold up. I just reread the commit message. What do you mean make it buildable without depending on `cmake.deps`?

Current docs (BUILD.md) state that Cygwin build requires user to install manually build/runtime dependencies, for example from Cygwin packages repo (setup.exe), and then compile neovim. But most of these deps can be downloaded and built locally by CMake scripts located under cmake.deps. That what I meant saying "without the need of manually installing the dependencies defined by cmake.deps" - there is no need to go though the manual installation via setup.exe for packages that are handled by cmake.deps. The method of "make && make install" shall just work now. 

>  You're modidying a file in `cmake.deps` though?

Only BuildLuajit.cmake.

BTW, some build/runtime deps are now missing from Cygwin repository and can no longer be conveniently installed via setup.exe.

> The method of "make && make install" shall just work now.

I tried this, ended up with tons of undefined references to ``lua_***`` functions (happened when linking ``cygnlua0.dll``). Then tried to hack a little and link ``cygnlua0.dll`` against ``liblua.a``, but another build error occured. AFAIR, it was "error loading module nlua0 [...] dynamic libraries not enabled" or something simillar.
Waiting for @dundargoc 's comments to be addressed. Also please explain a bit more what was done here, not just "Makes neovim buildable".
